Articles.Content: So other parts aren\'t mixing in with the list.

Looks really great, can\'t wait to try it out.

BTW, what the progress on the N1?
I can\'t choose the solar panels, the deployable ones, it says there is 0 amount in stock. There is also no animation for it on the menu. ???

I can\'t choose the solar panels, the deployable ones, it says there is 0 amount in stock. There is also no animation for it on the menu. ???

Because you\'re playing with the demo version. They\'ll only work in the full game.
Psst, psst! External module thingy! Psst! Docking! Psst!

Psst, psst! External module thingy! Psst! Docking! Psst!

You mean the feature that currently has no documentation, and as a result, can\'t be used? Good luck with that.

Need some ice for that burn?

Oh wait, you\'re just dumb.

You mean the feature that currently has no documentation, and as a result, can\'t be used? Good luck with that.

We\'re working on it. Documentation for the really bare basics is done, but we\'re hashing out the posting rules.

Need some ice for that burn?

Oh wait, you\'re just dumb.

O...kay? Totally uncalled for?

I\'m not even going to start. Silisko, thank me that I\'m saving the thread from a flame war. Anyways... I like the solar panels. Very realistic.
Bet you could hack up lander legs into a clamp, pending docs for a proper solution.

Bet you could hack up lander legs into a clamp, pending docs for a proper solution.

Aleheks on Something Awful has repurposed the landing legs as claws to clean up orbital debris in a prototype he calls SpaceJanitor One
Winston, you win.

Winston, you win.

ston.
How many orbital passes did it take to pinpoint the landing site?

How many orbital passes did it take to pinpoint the landing site?

I decided on my first pass and landed there on the second to pinpoint a nice flat area. Scout mission was pre-0.14, so when I downloaded the experimental I had already planned the area and specific little flat ledge that I would assemble my base on.
Cool. And you put each module into a low enough orbit to be able to see your previous ones, correct? That\'s also a pretty straight line you\'ve got going on, there.

Nova, I\'ve been thinking; Do you think it would be too hard for you to make a 'Mod' version of SE? I would like to have it with the original parts too.

:>

Nova, I\'ve been thinking; Do you think it would be too hard for you to make a 'Mod' version of SE? I would like to have it with the original parts too.

:>

...that\'s what I\'m doing already
Thank you, Nova, I can finally do realistic probe launches. This large munar probe fit nicely in a fairing shroud:

Cool. And you put each module into a low enough orbit to be able to see your previous ones, correct? That\'s also a pretty straight line you\'ve got going on, there.

I didn\'t need to, I knew the exact spot. Also as you can see at the start of the video you can see the landed parts in the map.
Must... Make.. Lunar rover...
Any estimate on the release date of SE 2.0?

Any estimate on the release date of SE 2.0?

Sometime between now and 0.15. That\'s the deadline I\'m setting myself.

I also want to make Probodobodyne completely functional - electricity, sun-tracking solar panels, functional space telescopes, remote input commands limited by the speed of light, the works.
So, any luck with these 'plugins' on the custom module loader?
